alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 4:38AM CDT until May 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River near Tahlequah. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, minor flooding occurs from near Hanging Rock downstream towards Tahlequah. Floating the river is too hazardous due to strong turbulence. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 11.5 feet tomorrow morning. It is forecast to fall below flood stage early tomorrow evening. Additional forecast rainfall is forecast to raise the river back above flood stage to a crest of 11.2 feet Thursday afternoon. The river is forecast to fall back below flood stage again Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
